definition: lit. to flood (idiom)/fig. rampant/in plague proportions
to succeed/to finish/to complete/to accomplish/to become/to turn into/to be all right/OK!/one tenth

sentences.english: The methamphetamine "pervitin" is one of the most widespread drugs in the area because of ease of availability.
sentences.chinese: 脱氧麻黄碱在当地可以轻易获得，因而泛滥成灾。

sentences.english: In 1970, high-grade heroin and opium flooded Southeast Asia.
sentences.chinese: 1970年东南亚的高纯度海洛因和鸦片泛滥成灾。

sentences.english: Poyang Lake helps keep down floods on the Changjiang River.
sentences.chinese: 在汛期，都阳湖有助于制止长江泛滥成灾。

sentences.english: Temples of witchcraft are so widespread that they have turned into kinds of social public hazard.
sentences.chinese: 宋代民间淫祠泛滥成灾，成为一种严重的社会公害。

sentences.english: HIV and drug use are skyrocketing in the valley.
sentences.chinese: 艾滋病和毒品在费尔干纳盆地泛滥成灾。

sentences.english: In history, the Yellow River flow City often are swamped.
sentences.chinese: 在历史上，黄河流城经常泛滥成灾。

sentences.english: In the end, superfluous tables were eliminated from the page.
sentences.chinese: 最终从网页中消灭了泛滥成灾的表格。

sentences.english: After a long period of rain the river may overflow its banks.
sentences.chinese: 久雨之后，河水会泛滥成灾。

sentences.english: The overflowing river has engulfed many towns and villages along its banks.
sentences.chinese: 泛滥成灾的河水已把其沿岸一带的许多城乡给淹没了。
不过马奇亚维利的名字着实已泛滥成灾。

sentences.english: The excessive rains caused widespread flooding.
Blame ancient stargazers with overactive imaginations.
sentences.chinese: 都怪古代的天文学家想象力“泛滥成灾”。

sentences.english: Vendors' stands spread unchecked, causing traffic jams.
sentences.chinese: 乱设摊点泛滥成灾，造成交通堵塞。

sentences.english: During the flood season, the Poyang Lake helps keep down floods on the Changjiang River.
sentences.chinese: 在汛期，都阳湖有助于制止长江泛滥成灾。

sentences.english: Heavy rains led to flooding in Kinshasa, Congo.
sentences.chinese: 豪雨导致刚果首都金夏沙泛滥成灾。

definition: to be in flood/to overflow (the banks)/to inundate/to spread unchecked
to go on the rampage/to riot/to run amuck
(of a watercourse) to breach its dike/(of dikes) to collapse
to be eradicated/to vanish/extinct/to break off relations
to blossom everywhere/to spring up all over the place/to flourish on a large scale
to submerge/to drown/to flood/to drown out (also fig.)
to breed/to flourish/to cause/to provoke/to create
to grow (usually of abstract things)/to yield/to develop
ever more critical/problems get more and more intense
